meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or containing olefins.
meanings.sent1: The chemist studied the olefinic compounds in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The plastic bottle was made from an olefinic material.
meanings.sent3: The olefinic smell of the gas station made her wrinkle her nose.
meanings.sent4: His speech had an olefinic quality, drawing in the audience with its double bonds of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The artist used an olefinic color palette, creating vibrant and lively paintings.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the presence of one or more carbon-carbon double bonds.
meanings.sent1: The olefinic molecule displayed unique properties in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The olefinic nature of the compound made it reactive in the reaction.
meanings.sent3: The chef's olefinic recipe combined flavors in an unexpected way.
meanings.sent4: Her olefinic personality shone through in her bold decisions.
meanings.sent5: The olefinic structure of the bridge symbolized strength and connection.
